storyTitle: As Attendance Manager, I want to review and approve manual attendance entries to ensure data accuracy

testCases.title: Approve manual attendance entry successfully
preconditions: User has valid Attendance Manager credentials
At least one manual attendance entry exists in pending status
Database is accessible and operational
User has approval permissions assigned to their role

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance management portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid Attendance Manager credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the attendance management dashboard

steps.action: Verify access to the manual attendance approval section in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance approval section is visible and accessible in the menu

steps.action: Click on the manual attendance approval section link
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the approval section and displays the pending entries page

steps.action: View the list of pending manual attendance entries
steps.expectedResult: List displays all pending manual attendance entries with columns showing employee ID, date, time, reason, and submitter information

steps.action: Select a specific pending entry from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Entry details page opens showing complete information including employee name, ID, date, time, reason for manual entry, and submitter details

steps.action: Review all details of the selected entry for accuracy and completeness
steps.expectedResult: All entry details are clearly displayed and readable

steps.action: Click the Approve button for the reviewed entry
steps.expectedResult: Approval confirmation dialog appears asking to confirm the action

steps.action: Confirm the approval action in the dialog
steps.expectedResult: System processes the approval within 2 seconds, entry status changes to 'Approved', success message is displayed, and timestamp with manager ID is recorded

steps.action: Verify that the submitter receives a notification about the approval
steps.expectedResult: Submitter receives notification via system notification and/or email confirming that their manual attendance entry has been approved

postconditions: Manual attendance entry status is updated to 'Approved' in the database
Approval action is logged in audit trail with timestamp and manager user ID
Entry is removed from pending list
Submitter has received approval notification
Attendance record is finalized in the system

testCases.title: Reject manual attendance entry with comments
preconditions: User has valid Attendance Manager credentials
At least one manual attendance entry exists in pending status
Database is accessible and operational
User has approval permissions assigned to their role

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance management portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid Attendance Manager credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the attendance management dashboard

steps.action: Verify access to the manual attendance approval section in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance approval section is visible and accessible in the menu

steps.action: Navigate to the manual attendance approval section
steps.expectedResult: Pending manual attendance entries list is displayed

steps.action: Select a pending manual attendance entry from the list
steps.expectedResult: Entry details page opens showing all information about the selected entry

steps.action: Review the entry details and identify issues requiring rejection
steps.expectedResult: Entry details are displayed clearly for review

steps.action: Click the Reject button for the selected entry
steps.expectedResult: Rejection dialog appears with a mandatory comments field

steps.action: Enter detailed rejection comments explaining the reason for rejection (e.g., 'Invalid time entry - conflicts with existing biometric record')
steps.expectedResult: Comments are accepted in the text field without character limit errors

steps.action: Click Confirm Rejection button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the rejection within 2 seconds, entry status changes to 'Rejected', rejection comments are saved, success message is displayed

steps.action: Verify that rejection details are recorded in the system
steps.expectedResult: Entry status shows 'Rejected', comments are saved and visible, timestamp and manager ID are recorded in audit trail

steps.action: Check that the submitter receives a rejection notification
steps.expectedResult: Submitter receives notification via system notification and/or email with rejection reason and comments included

steps.action: Verify the notification contains the rejection comments
steps.expectedResult: Notification displays the exact rejection comments entered by the manager

postconditions: Manual attendance entry status is updated to 'Rejected' in the database
Rejection comments are saved and associated with the entry
Rejection action is logged in audit trail with timestamp and manager user ID
Entry remains visible in rejected entries list
Submitter has received rejection notification with comments
Entry is not finalized in the attendance system

testCases.title: Prevent unauthorized user from accessing approval functionality
preconditions: User account exists without approval permissions
Role-based access control is configured and active
Manual attendance approval functionality exists in the system
Database and authentication services are operational

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance management portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter credentials of a user without approval permissions (e.g., regular employee or clerk without manager role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to their authorized dashboard

steps.action: Check the navigation menu for manual attendance approval section
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance approval section is not visible in the navigation menu

steps.action: Attempt to manually navigate to the approval section URL by typing it in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: System displays 'Access Denied' or '403 Forbidden' error page indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify that no approval functionality is accessible through the UI
steps.expectedResult: User cannot access any approval buttons, pending entries list, or approval-related features

steps.action: Open API testing tool (e.g., Postman) and attempt to call GET /api/manual-attendance/pending endpoint with the unauthorized user's authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Attempt to call POST /api/manual-attendance/approve endpoint with a valid entry ID using the unauthorized user's token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status code with error message 'User does not have approval permissions'

steps.action: Verify that no data is returned or modified by the unauthorized API calls
steps.expectedResult: No pending entries data is exposed and no approval actions are processed

steps.action: Check audit logs for the unauthorized access attempts
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs record the unauthorized access attempts with user ID, timestamp, and denied action

postconditions: Unauthorized user remains unable to access approval functionality
No manual attendance entries are modified
Security logs contain records of unauthorized access attempts
System security integrity is maintained
No sensitive data is exposed to unauthorized user

storyTitle: As Attendance Clerk, I want to input manual attendance entries to handle exceptions and corrections

testCases.title: Add manual attendance entry successfully
preconditions: User has valid Attendance Clerk credentials
User has manual attendance input permissions
At least one valid employee exists in the system
Database is accessible and operational
Manual attendance input section is available

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance system login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid Attendance Clerk credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the attendance clerk dashboard

steps.action: Verify access to the manual attendance input section in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance input section is visible and accessible in the menu

steps.action: Click on the manual attendance input section link
steps.expectedResult: System navigates to the manual attendance input page displaying the input form

steps.action: Click on 'Add New Manual Attendance Entry' button
steps.expectedResult: New entry form is displayed with fields for Employee ID, Date, Time, and Reason

steps.action: Enter a valid employee ID in the Employee ID field (e.g., 'EMP12345')
steps.expectedResult: Employee ID is accepted and system validates that the employee exists, displaying employee name if validation is successful

steps.action: Select a valid date from the date picker (current or past date)
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and displayed in the correct format (e.g., DD/MM/YYYY)

steps.action: Enter a valid time in the time field (e.g., '09:00 AM')
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and displayed in the correct format without validation errors

steps.action: Enter a reason for the manual entry in the Reason field (e.g., 'Biometric device malfunction')
steps.expectedResult: Reason text is accepted in the field

steps.action: Verify that all required fields are filled and no validation errors are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All fields show valid data with green checkmarks or no error indicators

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button to save the manual attendance entry
steps.expectedResult: System processes the entry within 2 seconds and displays a success confirmation message (e.g., 'Manual attendance entry saved successfully')

steps.action: Verify that the new entry appears in the list of manual attendance entries
steps.expectedResult: Newly created entry is visible in the manual attendance entries list with status 'Pending' and all entered details displayed correctly

steps.action: Check that the audit log records the manual entry action
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains a record of the manual entry creation with clerk user ID, timestamp, and entry details

postconditions: Manual attendance entry is saved in the database with status 'Pending'
Entry is visible in the manual attendance entries list
Audit trail contains record of the entry creation
Confirmation message is displayed to the clerk
Entry is ready for manager approval

testCases.title: Edit and delete manual attendance entry
preconditions: User is logged in as Attendance Clerk with appropriate permissions
At least one manual attendance entry exists in the system
Entry is in editable status (not yet approved)
Database is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the manual attendance input section from the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance input page is displayed showing list of existing manual entries

steps.action: Locate an existing manual attendance entry from the list
steps.expectedResult: List displays existing manual attendance entries with columns for Employee ID, Date, Time, Reason, and Status

steps.action: Click on the Edit icon or button for the selected entry
steps.expectedResult: Entry details are displayed in edit mode with all fields populated with current values and editable

steps.action: Verify that all current entry details are correctly displayed in the form
steps.expectedResult: Employee ID, Date, Time, and Reason fields show the existing values accurately

steps.action: Modify the Time field to a different valid time (e.g., change from '09:00 AM' to '10:30 AM')
steps.expectedResult: New time value is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Modify the Reason field to update the explanation (e.g., 'Biometric device malfunction - corrected time')
steps.expectedResult: Updated reason text is accepted in the field

steps.action: Click the Save Changes button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the update within 2 seconds and displays success confirmation message (e.g., 'Manual attendance entry updated successfully')

steps.action: Verify that the updated entry shows the modified values in the list
steps.expectedResult: Entry in the list displays the updated time and reason, with modification timestamp updated

steps.action: Check that the edit action is logged in the audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains a record of the modification with clerk user ID, timestamp, and changed fields

steps.action: Select the same or another manual attendance entry for deletion
steps.expectedResult: Entry is selected and Delete button or icon is visible and enabled

steps.action: Click the Delete button for the selected entry
steps.expectedResult: Deletion confirmation dialog appears asking 'Are you sure you want to delete this entry?'

steps.action: Click Confirm or Yes in the deletion confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: System processes the deletion within 2 seconds and displays success confirmation message (e.g., 'Manual attendance entry deleted successfully')

steps.action: Verify that the deleted entry is removed from the list
steps.expectedResult: Entry no longer appears in the manual attendance entries list

steps.action: Check that the deletion action is logged in the audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains a record of the deletion with clerk user ID, timestamp, and deleted entry details

postconditions: Modified entry is updated in the database with new values
Deleted entry is removed from the database or marked as deleted
Both edit and delete actions are recorded in audit trail
Confirmation messages are displayed for both operations
Manual attendance entries list reflects the changes

testCases.title: Prevent unauthorized access to manual attendance input
preconditions: User account exists without manual attendance input permissions
Role-based access control is configured and active
Manual attendance input functionality exists in the system
Database and authentication services are operational

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance system login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter credentials of a user without manual attendance input permissions (e.g., regular employee or viewer role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to their authorized dashboard

steps.action: Check the navigation menu for manual attendance input section
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance input section is not visible or accessible in the navigation menu

steps.action: Attempt to manually navigate to the manual attendance input URL by typing it in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: System displays 'Access Denied' or '403 Forbidden' error page with message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify that no manual attendance input functionality is accessible through the UI
steps.expectedResult: User cannot access any input forms, entry lists, or manual attendance-related features

steps.action: Open API testing tool (e.g., Postman) and attempt to call POST /api/manual-attendance endpoint with the unauthorized user's authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status code with error message 'User does not have manual attendance input permissions'

steps.action: Prepare a valid manual attendance entry payload with Employee ID, Date, Time, and Reason
steps.expectedResult: Payload is prepared in correct JSON format

steps.action: Send the POST request to create a manual attendance entry using the unauthorized user's token
steps.expectedResult: API returns authorization error and no entry is created in the database

steps.action: Attempt to call PUT /api/manual-attendance/{id} endpoint to edit an existing entry using the unauthorized user's token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status code with appropriate error message

steps.action: Attempt to call DELETE /api/manual-attendance/{id} endpoint to delete an entry using the unauthorized user's token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status code with appropriate error message

steps.action: Verify that no manual attendance entries are created, modified, or deleted
steps.expectedResult: Database remains unchanged and no unauthorized operations are executed

steps.action: Check security audit logs for the unauthorized access attempts
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs record all unauthorized access attempts with user ID, timestamp, attempted action, and denied status

postconditions: Unauthorized user remains unable to access manual attendance input functionality
No manual attendance entries are created, modified, or deleted
Security logs contain records of all unauthorized access attempts
System security integrity is maintained
Database remains unchanged from unauthorized attempts

storyTitle: As Attendance Clerk, I want to view attendance history for employees to verify and reconcile records

testCases.title: Search and view attendance history
preconditions: Attendance Clerk user account exists with valid credentials
Attendance Clerk has role-based access to attendance history section
Attendance database contains historical biometric and manual attendance records
Test employee ID exists in the system with attendance data
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance system login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid Attendance Clerk credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted and entered in the respective fields

steps.action: Click the Login button
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the attendance system dashboard

steps.action: Verify access to attendance history section in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Attendance history section is visible and accessible based on role-based access control

steps.action: Click on the Attendance History menu option
steps.expectedResult: Attendance history page loads displaying search interface with employee ID and date range fields

steps.action: Enter a valid employee ID in the employee search field
steps.expectedResult: Employee ID is accepted and displayed in the input field without errors

steps.action: Select a valid start date from the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Start date is selected and displayed in the date range field

steps.action: Select a valid end date from the date picker (after start date)
steps.expectedResult: End date is selected and displayed in the date range field without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Search button to submit the query
steps.expectedResult: Search query is processed and loading indicator appears

steps.action: Wait for search results to load
steps.expectedResult: Attendance records are displayed within 5 seconds showing combined biometric and manual attendance data in a tabular format

steps.action: Verify the displayed attendance records contain date, time, entry type (biometric/manual), and status columns
steps.expectedResult: All attendance records show complete information with both biometric and manual entries clearly identified

steps.action: Review the records for data accuracy and completeness
steps.expectedResult: Attendance data matches the selected employee and date range with accurate timestamps and entry types

postconditions: User remains logged in to the attendance system
Attendance history search results are displayed on screen
Search parameters remain in the input fields for reference
System logs the search query for audit purposes

testCases.title: Export attendance history data
preconditions: Attendance Clerk is logged into the attendance system
User has navigated to the attendance history section
Valid employee ID and date range have been entered
Attendance history search has been performed successfully
Search results are displayed on screen with attendance records
Browser allows file downloads

steps.action: Verify that attendance history search results are displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Attendance records are visible in tabular format with multiple entries

steps.action: Locate the Export button on the attendance history results page
steps.expectedResult: Export button is visible and enabled on the interface

steps.action: Click the Export button
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates and browser download dialog appears or file automatically downloads

steps.action: Wait for the CSV file download to complete
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is successfully downloaded to the default downloads folder

steps.action: Navigate to the downloads folder and locate the exported CSV file
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is present with a meaningful filename containing employee ID and date range information

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file using a spreadsheet application
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully displaying attendance data in structured columns

steps.action: Verify CSV file contains all expected columns (Employee ID, Date, Time, Entry Type, Status)
steps.expectedResult: All required columns are present with proper headers

steps.action: Verify the CSV data matches the attendance records displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: All attendance entries from the search results are accurately reflected in the CSV file with correct data

steps.action: Check that both biometric and manual attendance entries are included in the export
steps.expectedResult: CSV file contains combined biometric and manual attendance data as displayed in the search results

postconditions: CSV file is successfully downloaded and saved locally
Exported data is available for reconciliation purposes
User remains on the attendance history page with search results still displayed
Export action is logged in the system audit trail

testCases.title: Validate search input errors
preconditions: Attendance Clerk is logged into the attendance system
User has navigated to the attendance history section
Attendance history search interface is displayed
Date range fields and employee ID field are accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance history search page
steps.expectedResult: Search interface is displayed with empty employee ID and date range fields

steps.action: Enter a valid employee ID in the employee search field
steps.expectedResult: Employee ID is accepted and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Select an end date from the date picker
steps.expectedResult: End date is selected and displayed in the date range field

steps.action: Select a start date that is after the previously selected end date (invalid date range)
steps.expectedResult: Start date is entered in the field

steps.action: Observe the validation behavior on the date fields
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed indicating that end date cannot be before start date

steps.action: Attempt to click the Search button with invalid date range
steps.expectedResult: Search button is either disabled or clicking it triggers a validation error message preventing the search

steps.action: Verify the error message clearly states the validation issue
steps.expectedResult: Error message displays: 'End date must be after start date' or similar clear validation message

steps.action: Verify that no search query is executed with invalid inputs
steps.expectedResult: Search is blocked and no API call is made to the backend; no results are displayed

steps.action: Correct the date range by selecting a valid start date that is before the end date
steps.expectedResult: Valid start date is selected and validation error message disappears

steps.action: Verify the Search button becomes enabled after correcting the inputs
steps.expectedResult: Search button is now enabled and clickable without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Search button with corrected valid inputs
steps.expectedResult: Search query executes successfully and attendance records are displayed

postconditions: Invalid search attempts are blocked by validation
User is informed of input errors through clear error messages
System prevents invalid data from being submitted to the backend
After correction, search functionality works as expected
Validation errors are logged for system monitoring
